revised_title: Advanced Bioassay Techniques: Cross-Over Designs and Statistical Analysis
tldr: The article discusses cross-over designs in bioassay, a type of experimental design where each subject receives multiple doses or treatments. The author presents five different models for analyzing data from cross-over designs, focusing on models that incorporate autoregressive effects and residual correlations. The article also explores the use of 4-point assays, which enable potency estimation and provide a check on the validity of the procedure.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Bioassay and Experimental Design
